alert.note: Alert for Erie; Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 6:17AM EST until February 18 at 2:17PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New York... Cazenovia Creek Near Ebenezer affecting Erie County. Buffalo Creek AT Gardenville affecting Wyoming and Erie Counties. Cayuga Creek Near Lancaster affecting Wyoming and Erie Counties. .Heavy rain and snowmelt yesterday resulted in excessive runoff and flooding. For the Cazenovia Creek...including Ebenezer...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Buffalo Creek...including Gardenville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Cayuga Creek...including Lancaster...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Buffalo Creek Near Gardenville. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Flood stage, minor flooding is possible along the low lying areas next to Buffalo Creek, especially around the farm fields downstream from Union Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 AM EST Friday the stage was 7.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:15 AM EST Friday was 7.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 7.3 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.1 feet on 10/30/2012. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 130 PM EST.
